Municipal swimming pools Just behind, Roman Theater 150m, Museum 300m ... finally a treat!

title: (06800) Mérida - C / Diocles 6

title: (06800) Mérida - 2A Avenida Estudiante

title: (06800) Mérida - 24 Calle Octavio Augusto
description: Calle Octavio Augusto (Merida) very central and very large street. Busy enough for the day but quiet at night. A few meters from the amphitheater and the Roman Theater, Roman Museum. Near the center about 800 meters. Good for the night. A supermarket at 10m.

title: (06800) Mérida - 2P Calle Clara Campoamor Rodríguez
description: Peaceful sleeping area in Mérida. The area is a polygon even if you build, just behind a shopping park, with large supermarkets, hardware stores, fast food, etc ... title: (06800) Mérida - 4 Calle Cabo Verde

title: (06800) Mérida - 26 Avenida Vicente Sos Baynat
description: Along the river for a stop in the shade ...

title: (06800) Mérida - 2 Calle Cabo Verde
description: The Roman Theater car park is now one of the most modern car parks in Mérida. It is equipped with the latest technological devices for safety, accessibility and comfort. It had a new and innovative image for its time and was close to all the monuments of the historic center of Mérida. a remarkable fact in another parking lot. Right next to the Roman Circus and Casa del Mitreo and 5 minutes walk from the Roman Theater and Amphitheater, it should be noted that within a 10-minute walk you can reach everything in the historic center: Aqueduct of Miracles, Temple of Diana , Roman Bridge, etc. Directly next to an indoor pool you can swim for a daily fee. Restaurants and shops in the area. It's not just a Womo parking lot, this space is also used by a whole squadron of buses. I wasn't allowed to drive in in the late afternoon, everything was full of buses and cars, the Womos were so narrow I wouldn't be there FREE STAY ??

title: (06800) Mérida - 68B Avenida Extremadura

title_short: (06800) Mérida - 3 Calle Juan de Dios Román Seco

address.street: 3 Calle Juan de Dios Román Seco

title: (06800) Mérida - 1B Avenida Emérita Augusta
description: Gigantic parking on the river Guadiana. Asphalted. Space for many campingcars. 20min walking to the sights (Roman bridge, Alcazaba, Roman theater, etc.) along the river upstream. From the roundabout at the bridge drive about 300m on a one-way street to a turning circle whitch leeds you back on the river side of the parking lot. Attention! Every Tuesday from 5:00 to 15:00 weekly market. Almost completely occupied.

title: (06800) Mérida - 1A Calle Hoy Diario de Extrem 75
title_short: (06800) Mérida - 1A Calle Hoy Diario de Extrem 75
description:
OK first and foremost this is a great Aire. The community are providing an excellent place to park and an easy walk to the town and it’s amazing sights.

That said the booking system is awful. This is in part due to the fact the Aire is free at the moment and there is an incentive to book for three days even if you only stay one or two. This means there are unoccupied spaces that are showing up as occupied. 

It will bed down. When you check in only use the amount of days you require. Plus electricity can only be booked for two days. 

The shower ticket essentially is for the water, as both are unlocked. Again this is free at the moment an will give 15 min of hot and cold water. 

They will start charging in 2024 and perhaps it will get better.

title: (06800) Mérida - 6 Avenida Emérita Augusta
description: Very quiet street, next to a park and a Mercadona. There is a fountain in the park to catch water.

description: Water fountain in the park (push button). Right next to the park there is a Mercadona

Park4Night urban-style dream.

title: (06800) Urbanización de Proserpina -

title: (06800) Mérida - Unnamed Road

In the town of Alange, overlooking the water reservoir of the same name. Next to the football stadium there is a large free esplanade where you park and spend the night. The town is famous among other things for the Roman baths very close, besides activities in the nature: canoes, trekking, etc. Surrounded by small mountains of great beauty.
Park with water fountain next to the esplanade.

description: Ideal place for a stop, just off the A5 motorway. At the entrance of the town, good access and easy. Not highly recommended to spend the night because of the noise of the motorway. Without services, just a small fountain to drink.

title: (06411) Medellín - 62 Avenida Guadiana
description: Medellin area, next to the Guadiana River and bathing area. Very close to the beautiful town of Medellin, you can visit the castle, the Roman theater on foot is 1 km away, with water supply too, although the tap is one of the new ones without thread and is activated by pressure. Great to go with children. Restaurants and shops less than 100 meters away. On Thursday mornings there is a small market nearby. It has a wooded area and two esplanades. Nearby there is a playground for children and a picnic area.

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - Unnamed Road
description: Ample parking behind the municipal swimming pools. Very calm. On the way to the pre-Romanesque church of Santa Lucía del Trampal, about 3 km away, which deserves a visit. Trash and glass containers.

title_short: (06190) La Roca de la Sierra - EX-100

title: (10132) Almoharín -
description: "Natural paradise of Kiko cosquilla" In our space: we are free from extremes, we share, we respect each other, we laugh, we sunbathe, we read, we tell each other stories, an incubator of ideas, we enjoy the sunset and above all we love the earth and nature. What we try to do is create a confluence place for conscientious and daring people. We have our hens that are the queens of the space, orchard, wonderful shadows, barbecue, puff, hammocks... We also have accommodation with two rooms and a super cute caravan. Location: We are in the center of Extremadura in a rural environment 5 km from our town "Almoharin" where figs and fig bonbons are our star product. Neighbors of Montanchez with a ham that takes your mind away. We can also enjoy our cities just 30 minutes from Mérida, Trujillo and Cáceres. *We do breakfast on weekends. *Natural breads with slow fermentation (by order) *Eggs from our hens in freedom. *Figs. *box of assorted vegetables. If you want to share, respect and feel at peace you are WELCOME.

title: (10132) Almoharín - 16 Calle UE-9
description: Parking in Almoharín. Famous place for its chocolate figs. The gray and black water can be emptied and it has 6 water intakes on the ground, under iron covers. The intakes are prepared for wide hoses. Very close to the Visigoth Basilica of Santa Lucía del Trampal. And also near the Sierra de Montánchez where the thousand-year-old oak La Terrona is located.

name: Camper stop Alegria
title: (10170) Camper stop Alegria
description: The motorhome area is easy to access. There are 20 spacious plots, we are located a very short distance from the center of Montánchez, a very special little town, located in the heart of Extremadura and known in Spain for its delicious Iberian ham. Montánchez also offers a very well preserved castle, dating from Roman times, located next to one of the most beautiful cemeteries in Spain. Due to its location at an altitude of 700 meters, it offers spectacular views of the landscape, which is why it is also known as the "Balcony of Extremadura". For more information, see the website

name: Camping Las Grullas
title: (10185) Camping Las Grullas
description: Campsite Las Grullas. Naturist campsite. Excellent location, very peaceful and private. Thirty spaces and a chalet for rent. Electricity included. Water included and drinkable. Swimming pool and free wifi. Excellent facilities, well built and very clean. Very friendly owners who speak several European languages.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Concrete area between 4 olive trees. Great view of the somewhat dry lake. In the morning a flock of sheep came by. In sight is a neighbor with dogs barking in greeting ...

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: We spent a weekend here in May. Lots of space and several options for parking. A couple of fishermen here for the day, and a shepherd walking by with his flock. Lots of herons, storks and ducks. Very peaceful. Tracks in quite good repair and a large waste bin so not to much litter around. No problems with our 7m sprinter van.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Fantastic and wonderful view of the lake! complete silence, many storks and herons, only to hear the bells of the sheep in the distance. One of our favorite places.

Several bars at the entrance and another very famous for its spectacular suckling pigs in the center of town. It is very interesting to visit the Ermita del Salor and Las Corralás on foot. The town is very quiet and the people are hospitable.
